column3: was a huge green mound that stood alone in the middle of the burned and ruined land of Anfauglith. It had been raised by Morgoths Orcs after the victory in the terrible battle of Nirnaeth Arnoediad
column4: and beneath it lay the bodies of the Elves and Edain slain in that battle
column5: along with their gear and weaponry.

column1: Among the many slain heroes beneath the mound was Huor
column2: the brother of Húrin and great-grandfather of Elrond. According some tales
column3: Morgoth went there to taunt his prisoner Húrin after the Nirnaeth.
column4: p. 63 Huors wife Rían also went to the mound seeking her lost husband. When she came to the Hill of the Slain
column5: she laid down in grief and died.
